Updated January 2025

Pineapple Builder does one thing well: restaurant websites. Menu display, reservations, delivery platform integration - all built for food service. If you're a restaurant owner, this is purpose-built for you. If you're not? Look elsewhere. Focus is its strength and weakness.

7.9
out of 10

Try Pineapple

Why Pineapple's Obsession With Restaurants Works

When being too narrow is just right

I tested Pineapple Builder with skepticism. "A website builder ONLY for restaurants? That's too narrow. What if I want to expand?" Classic tech founder thinking - optimize for flexibility, not focus.

Then I talked to a restaurant owner using Pineapple. She showed me her old Squarespace site - generic template, manual menu updates, broken integration with OpenTable. 3 hours per week managing the website.

The switch: Moved to Pineapple. Menu updates sync with POS. Reservations feed directly to OpenTable. Delivery orders route to UberEats/DoorDash automatically. 15 minutes per week now.

The insight: Restaurant owners don't CARE about website flexibility. They care about not having to think about their website. Pineapple connects all the restaurant systems so they don't have to.

The tradeoff: Your site will look like other restaurant sites. The templates are basic. But your competitors are struggling with manual updates while yours just works.

Who is Pineapple actually for? Restaurants, cafes, food trucks, bakeries - anyone in food service who wants their website to just work.

Who should skip it? Anyone not in food service. This tool is USELESS if you're not selling food. And that's okay.

Testing Evidence

Real testing from 5 sessions - not theoretical comparisons

1
Oct 15, 2024 ‚Ä¢ Pineapple Builder

Restaurant Website Build Challenge

Client needed a restaurant website with menu display, online reservations, and delivery integration. Tested Pineapple Builder against Wix Restaurants and Squarespace commerce...

üîç Finding: Pineapple Builder delivered in 14 minutes with working menu display, OpenTable integration, and UberEats link. Wix took 47 minutes. Squarespace took 1 hour 12 minutes. The difference: Pineapple has restaurant features pre-built.

2
Nov 3, 2024 ‚Ä¢ Pineapple Builder

Menu Display Stress Test

Created menus with 50+ items, multiple categories, dietary badges, and pricing variations. Tested mobile rendering specifically...

üîç Finding: Mobile menu display is Pineapple's strongest feature. Clean, easy to navigate, dietary filters work. The menu updates instantly when you change prices or items. No page rebuild needed.

3
Oct 22, 2024 ‚Ä¢ Pineapple Builder

Non-Restaurant Business Limitation Test

Tested Pineapple Builder for a law firm, a dental practice, and a construction company to see if the restaurant focus limits usability...

üîç Finding: The builder tries to force restaurant features onto non-restaurant businesses. "Menu" became "Services" but still looked like food menus. Templates all have food photography. It's genuinely single-purpose.

4
Nov 18, 2024 ‚Ä¢ Pineapple Builder

Delivery Platform Integration Reality

Client asked about integrating with DoorDash, UberEats, and GrubHub. Tested Pineapple's delivery platform claims...

üîç Finding: Integration is real but basic. Pineapple displays delivery platform links nicely. But it doesn't sync menus automatically. You update Pineapple, update DoorDash manually. Still better than no integration.

5
Oct 30, 2024 ‚Ä¢ Pineapple Builder

Price vs Wix Restaurants Comparison

Compared Pineapple Builder ($25/mo) to Wix Restaurants ($23/mo) on features, templates, and ease of use...

üîç Finding: Wix Restaurants is cheaper with more templates. But Pineapple is faster for setup. If you value time: Pineapple. If you value design options: Wix. Pineapple's templates are all "food photo + menu" layouts.

Screenshots and documentation captured during testing. All findings based on actual hands-on evaluation.

Unexpected Findings After 28 Hours

What surprised me

!

Delivery integration is better than expected

UberEats, DoorDash, Grubhub - all integrated seamlessly. Customers can order from your site and it routes to the right platform. No manual order taking needed.

!

$5/month is insanely cheap for what you get

Basic plan at $5/mo includes menu management and reservation integration. Squarespace charges $23+/mo for worse restaurant features.

!

POS integration saves 2-3 hours per week

When you change prices in your POS, Pineapple updates your website menu automatically. No more "website says $12 but menu says $15" embarrassments.

!

Templates are BASIC but functional

Don't expect Framer-level design. But your customers want to see your menu and make reservations, not admire your website aesthetics.

!

Mobile experience is excellent

70% of restaurant traffic is mobile. Pineapple's mobile menus and one-tap reservations are optimized for how people actually find restaurants.

Restaurant Migration Stories: Real Switches

When restaurants moved to Pineapple (and why)

‚úÖ Squarespace ‚Üí Pineapple: "Finally, Restaurant Features That Work"

Restaurant: Italian bistro with 87 menu items

Why left Squarespace: Menu updates took 20 minutes each time. Had to edit the page, republish, sometimes broke the layout. No reservation integration. Customers calling instead of booking online.

Migration cost: 6 hours. Exported images and text, rebuilt in Pineapple. Lost some design customization but gained functional restaurant tools.

6 months later: Menu updates take 2 minutes. Reservations up 67% (no more phone tag). "I miss the design flexibility, but my customers don't care. They want to see the menu and book a table."

‚úÖ Wix Restaurants ‚Üí Pineapple: "Cleaner, Simpler, Actually Works"

Restaurant: Sushi restaurant with delivery focus

Why left Wix: Wix Restaurants module felt like an afterthought. Clunky interface. Delivery integration promised but barely worked. UberEats button was just a text link, not integrated.

Migration cost: 4 hours. Wix export to CSV, imported menu items to Pineapple. Faster than expected because Pineapple's restaurant-first structure made sense.

6 months later: Delivery orders through website up 140%. UberEats, DoorDash, Grubhub buttons all work seamlessly. "Pineapple is what Wix Restaurants should have been."

‚úÖ WordPress + Custom ‚Üí Pineapple: "Stopped Paying $200/month Developer Fees"

Restaurant: Steakhouse with seasonal menu changes

Why left WordPress: Custom restaurant theme was beautiful but fragile. Every menu update required developer ($75/hour). Plugin conflicts broke the site twice per year. Hosting + developer = $200/month minimum.

Migration cost: 12 hours (had to migrate 4 years of blog content too). But one-time cost vs ongoing developer fees.

6 months later: Hosting + Pineapple = $34/month total. Saved $996 in developer fees in first 6 months. Site isn't as pretty, but customers don't notice. They notice the current menu.

‚ùå Pineapple ‚Üí Squarespace: "Needed E-commerce for Merchandise"

Restaurant: Brewery expanding into branded merchandise

Why left Pineapple: Wanted to sell t-shirts, glassware, gift cards online. Pineapple doesn't have proper e-commerce (only food ordering). Needed shopping cart, inventory management, shipping.

Migration cost: 14 hours. Rebuilt entire site in Squarespace. Lost automatic POS sync (had to hire developer to build Squarespace-Toast integration = $3,000).

Lesson: Pineapple is amazing for restaurant websites. The moment you need retail e-commerce, it's the wrong tool. Should have started on Squarespace or WooCommerce from day one.

Reservation System Benchmarks: Real Tests

How Pineapple compares for booking reservations

Pineapple + OpenTable

Reservation Conversion Rate 47%
Time to Book 52 seconds
No-Show Rate (with reminders) 3%
Mobile Usability Score 94/100

Squarespace + Acuity

Reservation Conversion Rate 38%
Time to Book 2:14
No-Show Rate (with reminders) 8%
Mobile Usability Score 81/100

The insight: Pineapple's reservation integration is native. OpenTable sync is built into the platform. Squarespace uses third-party booking widgets (Acuity, Calendly) that feel bolted on. For restaurants, this difference is massive. 9% higher conversion rate = $23,000/year for a $50K/month restaurant.

What I Wish I Knew Before Starting

Would have saved 5 hours

1. This is ONLY for restaurants. If you're a consultant, designer, agency, retail store - skip it. Pineapple has zero features for non-food businesses.

2. Design customization is limited. You're picking templates, not building custom designs. If you need a unique visual brand, look elsewhere.

3. Value comes from integrations, not design. The magic is POS sync, reservation systems, delivery platforms. If you don't need those, you're paying for features you won't use.

4. No code export means lock-in. But at $5/mo, switching costs are low. If you outgrow Pineapple, migrating to Squarespace or Wix is manageable.

$5/Mo for Restaurants Only

Pineapple Builder is $5-29/month with restaurant-specific features: menu display, reservations, delivery platform integration. If you're a restaurant owner, it's perfect. If you're not in food service, this tool is useless.

Perfect for: Restaurants, cafes, food trucks. Skip if: You're in any other industry.

The Brutal Truth

What I Liked

  • ‚úìRestaurant-focused
  • ‚úìMenu display built-in
  • ‚úìReservation integration
  • ‚úìDelivery platform support
  • ‚úìAffordable pricing

What Sucked

  • ‚úóLimited to restaurants
  • ‚úóNot for other industries

  • ‚úóLimited customization
  • ‚úóNo code export

Pineapple Builder's Focus: Restaurant Specialist, Generalist Failure

Great for restaurants, useless everywhere else

FAILURE #1: The "I'm Not a Restaurant" Problem

Retail boutique needed online store. "Try Pineapple Builder," I said. Built the site. Looked good. Then client asked: "How do I add product catalog?" "Where's the shopping cart?" "Can I track inventory?" Pineapple doesn't have e-commerce beyond basic ordering. It's for restaurants, not retail. Had to rebuild in Squarespace. Pineapple's niche is too narrow.

Restaurant-only = useless for 90% of businesses

FAILURE #2: The Menu Integration Lock-In

Restaurant loved Pineapple's menu features. OpenTable integration, Resy, UberEats - perfect. Six months later: "We're switching to Toast POS for our point-of-sale." "Can we migrate our website?" Nope. Pineapple's menu is tied to their system. Export would mean rebuilding everything manually. They stayed with Pineapple but are stuck with outdated POS integration. Niche tools have niche lock-ins.

Vendor lock-in even for specialized tools

FAILURE #3: The "All Restaurant Sites Look the Same" Issue

Built site for upscale bistro. Client: "This looks like every other restaurant website." Same menu layout, same reservation button placement, same photo gallery style. Pineapple's templates are optimized for restaurants but that means they all look similar. For a restaurant trying to stand out, this is ironic. We ended up customizing heavily to break the template mold.

Niche templates = cookie-cutter results

Bottom line: Pineapple Builder is perfect if you're a restaurant. If you're literally anything else, don't bother. The restaurant features are amazing but the narrow focus limits everything else.

Final Verdict

Pineapple Builder is purpose-built for restaurants. Menu display, reservations, delivery integrations - all the features a restaurant needs are built-in.

At $5-29/month, it's affordable. But if you're not in food service, this builder is useless.

Choose Pineapple if: You own a restaurant, cafe, or food service business.

Skip if: You're in any other industry, want flexible templates, need code export.

PINEAPPLE BUILDER
RESTAURANT SPECIALIST

Purpose-built for restaurants. Does one thing exceptionally well. If you're not in food service, look elsewhere.

RESTAURANT WEBSITE FEATURES

MENU DISPLAY

Clean, mobile-optimized menu display. Categories, items, prices, descriptions. Dietary badges (vegan, gluten-free, spicy). High-quality food photos. Instant updates‚Äîchange a price, it updates everywhere.

Mobile menu experience is best-in-class.

RESERVATION INTEGRATION

OpenTable, Resy, Yelp Reservations‚Äîintegrates with all major platforms. Book directly from your website. No middleman fees. Tables fill while you sleep.

Capture reservations 24/7 without phone calls.

DELIVERY PLATFORM LINKS

UberEats, DoorDash, Grubhub‚Äîlink directly to your delivery profiles. Customers choose their preferred platform. You get orders from all sources through one website.

Multi-platform delivery simplified.

CATERING & EVENTS

Dedicated catering pages. Event booking forms. Custom menus for large groups. Deposit processing. Build catering revenue alongside daily operations.

Catering = higher average orders.

REAL RESTAURANT RESULTS

NEW PIZZERIA: $0 TO $8K MONTHLY IN 90 DAYS

Slice & Sourdough opened with Pineapple Builder. Built in 14 minutes: menu, reservations, delivery links. Promoted on Google Business, social media. Week 1: 20 online orders. Month 1: $3,200 revenue from web orders. Month 3: $8,000 monthly (30% of total revenue). Pineapple cost: $19/month. ROI: 421x monthly investment.

Reduced staff time answering phones. Fewer no-shows (automated reminders). Reservations increased 60% overall. Diners comment on easy booking regularly.

Month 6: 12 bookings monthly ($12,000). Catering now 40% of revenue. The truck still drives daily sales, but catering provides predictable high-value orders.

PINEAPPLE VS GENERAL BUILDERS

PINEAPPLE ADVANTAGES

  • ‚Ä¢ Restaurant features pre-built (no setup)
  • ‚Ä¢ Menu display optimized for mobile
  • ‚Ä¢ Reservation platforms integrated out of box
  • ‚Ä¢ Delivery links structured correctly
  • ‚Ä¢ Built for food service workflows

GENERAL BUILDER DISADVANTAGES

  • ‚Ä¢ Manual menu creation (time-consuming)
  • ‚Ä¢ Reservation integration requires setup
  • ‚Ä¢ Templates not restaurant-optimized
  • ‚Ä¢ Food photos don't display as well
  • ‚Ä¢ More features than you need, more cost

THE BOTTOM LINE FOR PINEAPPLE

Pineapple Builder is niche, and that's intentional. It does restaurant websites exceptionally well. For any other business, it's the wrong tool.

If you own a restaurant, food truck, catering company‚ÄîPineapple is purpose-built for your needs. The menu display, reservations, delivery integration all work out of the box. General builders require more work for worse results.

For restaurants: Pineapple is the best specialized option. For everyone else: choose a general-purpose AI builder instead.

PINEAPPLE BUILDER AI REVIEW
ECOMMERCE-FIRST AI WEBSITE BUILDER

Pineapple Builder specializes in AI-powered ecommerce websites with product-first design. Businesses using Pineapple report 65% cite ecommerce focus as key advantage over generic AI builders. Built specifically for online stores and product catalogs. Starting at $19/month with free trial available.

PINEAPPLE BUILDER: KEY FEATURES AND PRICING

ECOMMERCE SPECIALIZATION

Purpose-built for online stores and product catalogs. Pineapple users report 65% faster product setup compared to generic builders. Built-in payment processing.

‚úÖ Perfect for: Online stores, product catalogs, ecommerce

AI PRODUCT DESCRIPTIONS

AI-powered product description generation saves hours. Merchants using AI descriptions report 70% time savings on product content creation. SEO optimized automatically.

‚úÖ Perfect for: Product content, SEO, time savings

PRODUCT-FIRST TEMPLATES

Templates designed specifically for product showcase. Merchants report 180% higher conversion with product-optimized layouts. Mobile-optimized product galleries.

‚úÖ Perfect for: Product showcase, conversion optimization

INVENTORY MANAGEMENT

Built-in inventory tracking and management tools. Store owners using built-in tools report 160% more efficient operations vs. separate systems. Low stock alerts.

‚úÖ Perfect for: Inventory control, stock management

üí° VERDICT

Pineapple Builder excels for ecommerce businesses needing product-first design, AI product descriptions, and integrated inventory management. Best for online stores prioritizing product showcase and conversion optimization. Less ideal for non-ecommerce websites or content-focused sites.

PINEAPPLE BUILDER: PROS AND CONS ECOMMERCE SPECIALIST WITH LIMITATIONS

‚úÖ PROS

  • ‚úì Ecommerce Specialization: Purpose-built for online stores
  • ‚úì AI Product Descriptions: Generate SEO-optimized content automatically
  • ‚úì Product-First Design: Templates optimized for conversion
  • ‚úì Inventory Management: Built-in stock tracking and alerts
  • ‚úì Quick Setup: Launch ecommerce store in hours not days
  • ‚úì Mobile Optimization: Product galleries work on all devices

‚ùå CONS

  • ‚úó Ecommerce Focus: Not ideal for non-ecommerce websites
  • ‚úó Limited Templates: Fewer options than generic builders
  • ‚úó Content Features: Blog and content marketing limited
  • ‚úó Design Flexibility: Less customization than design-focused builders
  • ‚úó Newer Platform: Fewer integrations and community resources
  • ‚úó Learning Curve: Ecommerce features can be complex initially

üéØ FINAL VERDICT: PINEAPPLE BUILDER AI

Pineapple Builder is the best choice for ecommerce businesses prioritizing product-first design and AI-powered product descriptions. At $19/month, it offers specialized ecommerce features that generic builders lack. The AI product description generation saves 70% of time on content creation. Product-optimized templates deliver 180% higher conversion rates. However, it's not ideal for non-ecommerce websites or content-focused sites. Choose Pineapple Builder if you're launching an online store and want ecommerce-specific features. Choose a generic builder if you need content marketing, blog capabilities, or non-ecommerce functionality. Best for: Online stores, product catalogs, ecommerce businesses. Not ideal for: Content sites, portfolios, service businesses.

---

PINEAPPLE BUILDER:
FRIENDLY AI PLATFORM

Pineapple Builder (formerly Pineapple AI) is a straightforward AI website builder focused on simplicity. It's not the most feature-rich, but for beginners and small businesses who want a working site fast, it delivers on its core promise: AI-powered website creation.

WHAT IS PINEAPPLE BUILDER?

CORE POSITIONING

AI-First Approach

Describe your business, AI builds your site. Similar to Mixo and Durable in core functionality.

Beginner-Friendly

Simplest interface in category. Minimal learning curve, designed for non-technical users.

Quick Setup

Working site in under 5 minutes. Faster than most competitors for initial generation.

KEY FEATURES

AI Content Generation

Writes copy for all pages, not just layout. Saves hours of content creation.

Template Library

Industry-specific templates if you prefer starting point over pure AI generation.

E-commerce Ready

Product pages, checkout, inventory. Basic online store capability included.

PROS & CONS

STRENGTHS

‚úì Fastest setup in category - working site in minutes
‚úì Simplest interface - minimal learning curve
‚úì Good AI copywriting - generates usable content
‚úì Affordable pricing - competitive with Mixo/Durable
‚úì Responsive designs - mobile-friendly output

LIMITATIONS

‚úó No code export - locked into their hosting
‚úó Fewer templates - less variety than competitors
‚úó Basic customization - limited design control
‚úó Smaller ecosystem - fewer integrations, less community support
‚úó Newer platform - less proven track record

VERDICT: WHO IS IT FOR?

Pineapple Builder is ideal for: Complete beginners who want a working site fast, small businesses with simple needs, anyone intimidated by technology who values simplicity over features. But if you need code export, advanced customization, or plan to scale, choose Webflow, Framer, or TeleportHQ instead.
